decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly equip creatures with powerful equipment, particularly Colossus Hammer, to create a deadly threat on the battlefield. The deck utilizes cards like Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic to search for and equip the necessary pieces, while Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key artifacts. With the ability to create massive creatures with low mana investment, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient combos and aggressive plays. Additionally, Leyline Axe and Shadowspear provide support and utility to further enhance the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate mana quickly and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer. It also includes control elements like Karn, the Great Creator, Glaring Fleshraker, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck uses cards like Expedition Map and Mind Stone to ensure consistent mana production and includes removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on generating mana and controlling the game until it can assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo to deal lethal damage to the opponent. By using cards like Lotus Bloom, Whir of Invention, and Disrupting Shoal, the deck can quickly ramp up mana and protect its win condition. The inclusion of counter spells and removal helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up the combo for victory. The deck's lack of traditional lands makes it a unique and challenging archetype to pilot effectively in the Modern format.

Utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana, this Control deck aims to dominate the game by playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the board. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thought-Knot Seer and removal spells like Dismember, making it difficult for opponents to execute their game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands quickly and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive plays.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of artifact creatures and powerful artifacts. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to generate card advantage and resources, the deck aims to play aggressively and disrupt the opponent's game plan with spells like Galvanic Blast and Metallic Rebuke. With the help of efficient mana sources like Mox Opal and Mox Amber, the deck can quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield and threaten to end the game in its favor.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain tempo with cards like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride. Utilizing cards like Static Prison and Arena of Glory to control the board, while also having access to burn spells like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional reach. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient threats and removal.

The main purpose of this Dimir Control deck is to manage and disrupt opposing strategies through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption. By controlling the pace of the game with powerful cards such as Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to maintain board control and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. The inclusion of threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provides a win condition, while cards like Cling to Dust and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student offer card advantage and utility to outvalue the opponent.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana using Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl, while controlling the board with removal spells like Kozilek's Command and Dismember. It aims to slow down the opponent with cards like Malevolent Rumble and Writhing Chrysalis, while creating token creatures with Sowing Mycospawn. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Emrakul, the Promised End, as well as a secondary win condition with Devourer of Destiny. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on assembling the powerful UrzaTron lands to generate a substantial amount of mana quickly. It uses control elements such as counterspells, removal, and hand disruption to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer to maintain board presence and pressure. The deck also includes cards like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust to clear the board if needed. The goal is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and mana advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The goal is to keep up a constant stream of damage, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Searing Blaze and Boros Charm. The deck aims to win the game by dealing as much damage as possible in the shortest amount of time, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards quickly to get to the key combo piece, Living End, which allows the player to return all creatures from their graveyard to the battlefield. By using cards like Street Wraith and Generous Ent to cycle through the deck and generate card advantage, the player can set up a big board presence in a single turn. Additionally, cards like Ardent Plea and Shardless Agent help manipulate the top of the deck to set up the combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Negation to protect the combo and Endurance to disrupt graveyard strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer, then utilize Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to tutor for and put powerful lands into play. By combining specific lands such as Urza's Saga, Gruul Turf, and The Mycosynth Gardens, the deck is able to generate incredible value and potentially win the game in just a few turns. The focus is on utilizing land synergies and powerful combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game by countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan using counterspells like Force of Negation and Spell Snare, removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Galvanic Discharge, and card draw/filtering spells like Consult the Star Charts and Tune the Narrative. The deck also includes powerful win conditions like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Wrath of the Skies to close out the game. With a mix of control elements and strong finishers, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to search for key lands and combo pieces. The deck aims to utilize lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to generate additional mana, while also utilizing cards like Urza's Saga for additional value. With the ability to search for specific lands and assemble powerful combinations, this deck is designed to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory through efficient combo plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of different cards and abilities to create powerful combos without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lotus Bloom, and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to control the game without the need for typical land cards. Additionally, cards like Flare of Denial and Disrupting Shoal provide additional control elements, while cards like Tameshi, Reality Architect and Thundertrap Trainer offer unique win conditions. Overall, the deck focuses on innovative strategies and alternative win conditions to outmaneuver opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells, discard spells, and removal. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures with flash like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ketramose, the New Dawn to maintain control over the board. The inclusion of cards like Relic of Progenitus and Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's graveyard and hand. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and establishing a dominant board presence.
